title: Add comprehensive example project
description: Create an examples/ directory with a realistic Camunda 7 Spring Boot application that demonstrates: parallel test execution with multiple BPMN processes, WireMock external service stubs on dynamic ports, schema isolation with real PostgreSQL (via Testcontainers), and before/after comparison showing speed improvement. This is a roadmap item.

title: Make WireMock port count configurable
description: The DEFAULT_WIREMOCK_PORT_COUNT is hardcoded to 3 in ParallelTestExecutionListener. Add an attribute to the @ParallelFunctionalTest annotation (e.g. wiremockPorts = 3) so users can specify how many ports they need per test class. Some tests may need 0 (no WireMock), others may need more than 3.
close_reason: Implemented and all 41 unit tests passing

title: Add schema-aware DataSource wrapper
description: After creating an isolated schema, the library needs to ensure the Camunda engine and application code actually use that schema. Currently the schema name is set as a system property but nothing forces the DataSource to switch to it. Need a DataSource decorator or connection initializer that issues SET search_path TO <schema> on each connection, or configure spring.datasource.hikari.schema to route connections to the correct schema.
close_reason: Implemented and all 41 unit tests passing

title: Add JUnit parallel execution configuration support
description: Provide a default junit-platform.properties resource or documentation/auto-configuration that enables JUnit 5 parallel execution (junit.jupiter.execution.parallel.enabled=true, mode=concurrent). Currently users must configure this themselves which is easy to miss. Consider a Gradle plugin or test resource that sets sensible defaults.

title: Add proper logging (replace System.err.println)
description: ParallelTestExecutionListener uses System.err.println for error logging during cleanup. Replace with SLF4J logger for proper log level control and consistency with Spring Boot's logging infrastructure.

title: Publish to Maven Central
description: Set up publishing to Maven Central so the library can be consumed as a standard dependency. Requires: Sonatype OSSRH account, GPG signing configuration, maven-publish plugin updates, and CI/CD pipeline for release automation. The release.yml GitHub workflow exists but needs to be connected to actual publishing.

title: Add Testcontainers integration for automatic PostgreSQL provisioning
description: Provide an optional Testcontainers-based mode where the library automatically starts a shared PostgreSQL container and creates isolated schemas within it. This would give a zero-config experience: annotate with @ParallelFunctionalTest and everything (DB, schema, ports) is handled. Testcontainers is already a test dependency.

title: Implement process engine instance isolation
description: Each parallel test class needs its own isolated Camunda ProcessEngine instance to avoid shared state. Currently only database schema isolation is provided, but the process engine itself (deployment cache, job executor, etc.) is still shared. Need to ensure each test context boots its own engine pointed at its isolated schema. This is a core roadmap item.

title: Add support for databases beyond PostgreSQL
description: Currently only PostgresSchemaIsolationStrategy exists. The SchemaIsolationStrategy interface is already in place, but implementations are needed for other databases commonly used with Camunda: H2 (in-memory with separate databases per test), MySQL/MariaDB (schema isolation), and potentially Oracle. H2 support would be especially valuable for projects that don't use Testcontainers.

title: Fix System.setProperty usage for per-context property injection
description: The ParallelTestExecutionListener uses System.setProperty() to inject dynamic schema and port properties. This is process-global and not isolated per Spring ApplicationContext, meaning concurrent test classes in the same JVM can overwrite each other's properties. Should use Spring's TestPropertyValues, DynamicPropertySource, or a custom ApplicationContextInitializer to inject properties into each test's own ApplicationContext.
close_reason: Implemented and all 41 unit tests passing
